DataElement.preferredName: Eating Disorder Examination Bariatric Surgery Interview Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake._An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._Surgery performed in morbidly obese patients to help promote weight loss. The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach._A conversation with an individual regarding his or her background and other personal and professional details, opinions on specific subjects posed by the interviewer, etc._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake._An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._Surgery performed in morbidly obese patients to help promote weight loss. The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach._A conversation with an individual regarding his or her background and other personal and professional details, opinions on specific subjects posed by the interviewer, etc.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake.

The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach.:A conversation with an individual regarding his or her background and other personal and professional details, opinions on specific subjects posed by the interviewer, etc.

Concepts.definition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Surgery performed in morbidly obese patients to help promote weight loss. The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach.
A conversation with an individual regarding his or her background and other personal and professional details, opinions on specific subjects posed by the interviewer, etc.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
